title: Liverpool legend Steve Nicol brands Kop flops "ROTTEN" after shock defeat to Leicester halts Reds' top four dreams
text:
Sport Liverpool legend Steve Nicol brands Kop flops "ROTTEN" after shock defeat by Leicester halts Reds' top four dreams The Reds are just a point outside the top four but have only won once in the Premier League in 2017 Share Get Liverpool   
Liverpool legend Steve Nicol has laid into Jurgen Klopp's flops, claiming they are "rotten". 
Nicol was dismayed by Liverpool's lame display in last night's 3-1 defeat at Leicester , which has dealt a hammer blow to their Champions League hopes, and branded it unacceptable. 
The European Cup winner and 1986 Double winner questioned the players' desire and he is unsure if they really want to finish in the top four. 
Yet again Liverpool slipped up against a side in the bottom half of the table and Nicol says that is damning for the players' attitude. Liverpool have only gathered six points this year (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Klopp has struggled to maintain consistency (Photo: Andrew Powell) Read More Klopp is to blame for Reds' defeat at Leicester, slams Anfield legend Jamie Carragher 
"Liverpool haven't been able to get up to play against anybody in the bottom half of the table, pretty much all season," said Nicol, who is a pundit in the US for ESPN. 
"What we're seeing is a Liverpool side that is either feast or famine. They're either fantastic or they're just plain rotten and today they were just plain rotten. 
"Where was that energy that at the start of the season Liverpool had? Closing people down, running at defenders, good movement. You name it, Liverpool had it. 
"Do Liverpool actually realise they've got a chance of finishing in the top four? This performance today reminded me of a side who were stuck bang in the middle of the table who couldn't go down and who couldn't go up any higher or get into Europe or anything. Klopp looks on as his flops lose to managerless Leicester (Photo: Leicester City FC via Getty Images) Philippe Coutinho and James Milner show different emotions just after Jamie Vardy put the Foxes 3-0 up (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Klopp's Liverpool record is MUCH worse than David Moyes' was at Manchester United 
"It's just not acceptable and this was about as vanilla a performance from Liverpool as you've seen all season." 
Liverpool have won just two games in 2017 as their hopes of silverware have evaporated and former midfielder Danny Murphy says their collapse shows their squad is not good enough. 
He compared them to the huge strength in depth at champions elect Chelsea and says Klopp must rebuild in the summer. 
"You look at the Liverpool bench compared to Chelsea," he told talkSPORT. Nicol is envious of runaway leaders Chelsea's squad (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Read More
